","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"update_change","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is the final step in handling function side effects. After ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"merge_change","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" has calculated ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"what","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" changed, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"update_change","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" applies those changes to the current environment. It updates the actual Definitions and Scopes to reflect the new state of variables.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dfae9f2f-38d5-49ef-9ec1-ba48a1f74496","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Calculating changes is useless if you don't apply them. This function "commits" the side effects to the analyzer's memory. If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"setup()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" initializes a global variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"APP_NAME","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", this function ensures that the definition ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"APP_NAME","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is actually created/updated in the module scope so that subsequent lines can find it.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"5d415db3-5048-4525-a500-0d198ba92c26","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it
